David Norris.Action: Acknowledges crowd warmly and confidently as he walks out to speak, showing confidence and ease with people.
Modestly deflects praise from Charlie Traynor by saying 'Don't build me up like that, he'll be disappointed.'
Appears relaxed and confident while preparing for a public speech, calmly interacts with his team.
Acknowledges the crowd with a clear and confident introduction during a campaign event, handles public speaking well.
Finishes a speech at the FDNY Academy's graduation receiving a standing ovation.
Shakes hands with workers at a utility plant, showing genuine enjoyment in campaigning unlike most politicians.
Plays basketball with teenagers, maintaining a relatable and approachable presence.
Leads a ceremonial groundbreaking for redevelopment, demonstrating leadership in public duties.
Gives a speech at a Harlem church inspiring audiences similarly to famous leaders.
Walks through a mall calmly engaging with the public and media, feeding off public attention confidently.
Overcomes a hoarse voice to speak outdoors at an upstate farmers gathering using a bullhorn effectively.
Feels bothered by silence in his hotel room contrasting with noisy campaign trail but uses quiet time to review detailed itinerary and prepare upcoming speeches.
His ability to retain and recall detailed information (names, dates, and events) without reviewing shows impressive mental capacity and preparation.
Continuing to drink beer and socialize late despite having an important early morning interview and event indicates possible poor self-discipline and lack of prioritization.
He is leading in polls and has active supporters working the phones and laptops for his campaign.
Watches election coverage where pundits criticize him for being blunt and impulsive, which made him look like an amateur and hurt his campaign.
Puts on a brave face despite realizing he will lose the election badly and face public humiliation.
Puts on a brave face despite realizing he will lose the election badly and face public humiliation.
Almost killed his entire political career five months ago with an act of immaturity that ended up on the front page.
Acknowledges the reality of the election results quickly and realistically.
Acknowledges the tense and somber mood, seeks solitude to prepare his speech calmly before addressing his supporters.
Avoids the press outside the hotel to find privacy, showing awareness of his environment and emotional state.
Appears unable to confront the crowd or face his audience confidently, as he cannot look at them and seeks to isolate himself.
Takes a moment to compose himself in the mirror, fighting to hold himself together.
Engages in light, self-deprecating humor about his past embarrassing incident.
Admits to losing the Senate race candidly.
Dismisses the photograph scandal realistically, acknowledging its impact on his reputation.
Acknowledges the empathy and beauty of his opponent's eyes; expresses understanding rather than bitterness about losing the election.
Engages in light, self-deprecating humor with the woman, showing openness and approachability.
Takes the offered champagne after hesitation, joining in friendly social exchange.
Acknowledges losing the election and accepts public criticism gracefully.
Takes a gulp of champagne despite hesitating initially, showing some self-awareness but also a casual attitude.
Admits bluntness as a factor in losing the campaign, demonstrating insight into his own weaknesses.
Makes light of serious situations (dropping his drawers during campaign) somewhat self-deprecatingly, which could indicate a lack of control over image.
Leans in and kisses the woman in a sincere, spontaneous moment, then laughs with her afterward.
Shows concern and tries to call the woman back when she starts to leave suddenly.
Responds to Charlie's confusion with openness and a big grin, showing lightheartedness and sincerity.
Drinks and hesitates when asked about running again, showing uncertainty and avoiding a direct answer.
Teases the woman by mispronouncing 'Lynwood' as 'Lynfield,' showing social ease and wit.
Laughs with the woman after an unexpected kiss, demonstrating relaxed confidence in a spontaneous moment.
Chases after the woman when she leaves abruptly, showing initiative and concern rather than passivity.
Admits uncertainty with 'I'm really not sure' after the woman is chased by security, reflecting honest self-awareness but some confusion.
Smiles broadly and declares readiness to give his speech despite earlier uncertainty, indicating emerging confidence and resolve.
Shares personal background including fights but uses humor to connect with the audience.
Delivers a sincere and reflective victory speech acknowledging setbacks and emphasizing resilience.
Expresses a deep desire to serve others and make the world a better place after a traumatic experience.
Wakes up early, works out vigorously with high energy like a 25-year-old.
Has a spacious apartment with organized work materials, indicating preparedness and professionalism.
Is announced as Vice Chairman of RSR Capital, suggesting recognized capability and leadership.
Worked at Goldman Sachs for four years and successfully ran for Congress at 25, showing intelligence and skill.
Rushes over to answer the ringing blackberry quickly, trying to figure out how to use the new phone.
Knows to mute the TV before answering the phone, showing awareness in a professional setting.
Admits not being used to the new phone yet and directs the caller to another number.
Engages in a conversation about compliance regulations and follows protocol (using the blackberry for firm business).
Notices Harry sprinting after the bus and attempts to alert the bus driver.
Sits next to the woman from election night and engages in a playful, confident conversation despite initial self-consciousness.
Laughs and shares a playful banter with the woman, enjoying the moment sincerely.
Responds to interruptions and distractions (phone cutting out) with light humor and patience.
Engages in friendly teasing and conversational give-and-take about clothes and habits.
Mentions starting a new job without elaboration or seeking sympathy, showing some emotional reserve.
Maintains a playful and confident banter with the Woman, showing social poise and quick wit.
Answers his phone promptly but the call fails due to no signal, and he immediately informs the Woman about the line cut.
Appears mindful of his clothing coordination and responds to critique with humor and awareness.
Cannot maintain phone reception, with his Blackberry going dead twice in a short span.
Apologizes and offers to pay for spilling coffee on a woman's dress.
Engages playfully and respectfully with the woman by responding humorously and asking for her number.
Grabs the coffee cup away from the woman, playfully struggles with her, and suppresses laughter.
Shows frustration when the woman answers his phone and drops it in coffee, but remains engaged with her.
Watches Elise leave the bus and sincerely admits he thought about her the morning after losing.
Grabs the coffee cup firmly to prevent it from being spilled on him during playful struggle, maintaining composure and control.
Lunges for his phone after it is taken away, but fails to retrieve it, showing some loss of control.
Responds to playful antagonism with humor and confidence, engaging well socially.
Stares incredulously and locks eyes with Elise, showing emotional openness and social intelligence.
Keeps Elise's number carefully and enjoys a moment of genuine happiness from their connection.
Shares the detail of sitting next to Elise with his friend Charlie, revealing openness and excitement.
Carefully tucks Elise's number into his wallet after seeing it.
Enjoys the most satisfying sip of coffee but just misses spilling it on himself due to bad timing.
Calls Charlie to share an update about sitting next to the woman from election night on the bus, indicating social awareness and engagement.
Waves to the receptionist as he passes by, despite no response or acknowledgment.
Attempts to call Charlie repeatedly despite failed calls, then pockets phone and moves on.

Loudly and playfully calls out to people in an empty office, showing confidence and presence.
Notices that Susan is frozen, physically checks on her, quickly identifies an emergency situation and calls for help.
Rushes into Charlie's office, immediately reacts with alarm to the strange situation, asks questions to confront the men in suits.
Upon being ordered to be grabbed, he bolts and attempts to escape quickly.
Gets trapped when the door he tries to exit through locks behind him.
Curses when trapped and rushes to escape despite danger.
Attempts to evade Richardson by sprinting, using stairs quickly, and diving around obstacles despite physical limitations.
Is captured after being chloroformed unexpectedly despite efforts to escape.
Says 'Hey' to the suits after being tied up, attempting to engage despite his vulnerable position.
Asks 'Can somebody tell me what's going on?' showing openness and a desire for communication.
Crane around tied to a chair to observe who's talking; attempts to engage by saying 'Hey' and asking 'Can somebody tell me what's going on?'
Unties the rope restraining him quietly while others are distracted, demonstrating resourcefulness and situational awareness.
Shows some confusion by needing to ask what is happening, indicating incomplete understanding of the situation.
Leaps up and attempts to escape despite danger, showing trust in his own instincts.
Involuntarily tries to shield his thoughts, indicating vulnerability and sincerity.
Stares back defiantly at Richardson, indicating resistance but not hostility or coldness.
Attempts to escape captivity by leaping up and sprinting toward an open door despite not knowing all the forces at play.
Falls after tripping on the manipulated floor and is quickly subdued again.
Tries to mentally block his thoughts from being read, showing self-awareness and quick thinking under pressure.
Displays confusion and an inability to immediately make sense of highly unusual and overwhelming revelations.
Expresses concern about what was done to Charlie, questioning Richardson.
Listens quietly and appears shell-shocked when confronted with the Adjustment Bureau's threats.
Takes in and processes complex and threatening information about the Adjustment Bureau calmly despite being shell-shocked.

Tries to ask questions about the Bureau's actions (e.g., asks 'Why Charlie? What did you do to him?').
Shows hesitation and uncertainty, still trying to get his bearings after the revelations.
Questions Richardson about seeing Elise and challenges why it matters, showing concern and sincerity towards the woman.
Insists he should be allowed to go as promised, displaying trustworthiness and honor.
Does not react with aggression or anger when forcibly restrained, indicating restraint and tolerance in a difficult situation.
Questions Richardson about why he cares and why he saw Elise, showing reluctance or hesitation.
Complies initially and walks toward the door when told he is free to go, showing caution and restraint.
Attempts to assert his right to leave by reminding Richardson that he was told he could go, displaying some confidence but no immediate effective resistance.
Reacts with visible distress and desperation when his connection to Elise is forcibly and violently severed.
Sits alone at a bar with trembling hands, showing vulnerability and emotional sensitivity.
Complies with Harry's request to go back to work and wait for further contact despite being shaken, showing cooperative and respectful behavior.
Struggles against multiple guards but is unable to free himself.
Remains calm and orients himself after being released in an unfamiliar location.
Sits quietly at the bar, trembling slightly, without retaliating or acting rashly.
Agrees to follow Harry's instructions and plans to continue normal activities while awaiting further communication.
Responds briefly and apologetically to Charlie after being called multiple times; shows some social acknowledgment despite internal distraction.
Avoids elaborating on personal distress when Charlie inquires about him; non-responsive to friendly concern.
Enters office hesitantly, unsure and disoriented by the new environment.
Acknowledges others politely (thanks secretary), but appears distracted and preoccupied.
Listens to colleague Charlie and responds minimally, showing internal struggle but maintains composure.
Sits quietly on a bench reflecting alone, showing vulnerability and thoughtfulness.
Claims to have lost a woman's number due to being pickpocketed, possibly avoiding admitting fault.
Engages in candid conversation with Harry about his feelings and experiences.
Questions Harry patiently and shows concern about why the Adjustment Bureau cares about his relationship with Elise.
Considers carefully Harry's warnings and the seriousness of the situation without dismissiveness.
Asks targeted questions about risks and the surveillance situation, demonstrating curiosity and critical thinking.
Shows concern about being followed and about the reasons behind others' actions, indicating awareness and cautiousness.
Presses for understanding of motives rather than reacting impulsively, showing controlled and strategic behavior.
Focuses on his relationship with Elise even as his reality shatters, showing human vulnerability but also distraction from larger issues.
Remains silent when advised to move on from his search for her, showing emotional restraint but underlying care.
Face hardens when told to forget her, indicating emotional investment and sincerity in his feelings.
Lies awake staring at the ceiling after waking up alone, reflecting deep concern and attachment toward her.
Buys additional apartments and expands his living space over three years, a decision not directly linked to warmth.
Remains silent when advised by Harry that finding the woman is nearly impossible, showing hesitation or contemplation.
Hardens his face and responds strongly to Harry's message, indicating resolve and emotional firmness.
Lies awake after the advice to move on, showing internal conflict and passivity.
Immediately stops the bus and runs to catch up to a woman he recognizes, showing eagerness and genuine interest.
Displays detachment and subdued demeanor compared to before, indicating emotional restraint or distance.
Sincerely expresses that he rode the M1 to work for three years hoping to see Elise again.
Honest about not having a girlfriend and asks Elise to talk despite her skepticism.
Softens Elise with a smile and shows attentiveness to her feelings.

Expresses honest intention and vulnerability to Elise despite her skepticism.

Shows vulnerability and willingness to take emotional risks despite Elise's wariness.

Swears sincerely that he didn't have Elise's number, even swearing on his parents' graves, expressing honesty and attempting to be trustworthy.
Shows relief upon learning Elise is single, indicating concern about her feelings and social implications.
Initially evades direct confession about why he never called, trying to justify himself but ultimately shows vulnerability.
Does not immediately admit to having had a girlfriend, potentially withholding truth and complicating trust.

Fails to anticipate Elise's skepticism about his excuse, leading to her doubting his honesty.
Swears on his parents' graves to assert truthfulness, showing earnestness but also possibly a defensive tactic to gain trust.

Appears somewhat reactive rather than proactive in the conversation, allowing Elise to lead and leaving himself vulnerable.
